defitem.label: Encoded by:
defitem.item: Machine-readable finding aid derived from MARC record by David Sun.

titlepage.p: 2009 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, notes, genealogical charts, certificates, and photographs, relating to the history of the Sviatopolk-Mirskii family from the tenth to the twentieth century, and to Russian migraffairs. Consists mainly of drafts of and working materials for a genealogical history. Includes photographs of Emperor Nicholas II and Empress Alexandra.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kniaz' Nikolai Vladimirovich Sviatopolk-Mirskii papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1971.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Russian aristocrat; migrin Yugoslavia and Switzerland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, correspondence, notes, genealogical charts, certificates, and photographs, relating to the history of the Sviatopolk-Mirskii family from the tenth to the twentieth century, and to Russian migraffairs. Consists mainly of drafts of and working materials for a genealogical history. Includes photographs of Emperor Nicholas II and Empress Alexandra.
